result.execSummary:
All charges against Derek Michael Gondik in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Michael Gondik is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

01:41 PM Defendant Derek Michael Gondik in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Derek Michael Gondik in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will stay at mother's address in Minong or alternate address inside of Superior.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading enter pleas of not guilty. Court will accept not guilty pleas. State requests $1000 signature bond with conditions of No contact with Rick Gondik, his place of residence, or his place of business,  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Atty Hoffman has no objections. 
Court orders $1000 sginature bond with conditions of No contact with Rick Gondik, his place of residence, or his place of business,  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, defendant must update the Clerk of Court with address wtihin 24 hours of release from the jail. 
Defendant wishes to have a change of venue. Defendant requests speedy trial.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
